honeywell.printer

Class Parameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • honeywell.printer.Parameters
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ParametersDPL, ParametersExPCL_LP, ParametersExPCL_PP, ParametersEZ, ParametersLP

    public abstract class Parameters
extends java.lang.Object
    This base class represents the general parameters that can be used to alter the printing characteristics when 'printing' to a Document object. Printing characteristics are 'local' to each print command they are passed into. To have global settings the same parameters object can be passed into each write call to the Document object.

      • Parameters

        public Parameters()

    • Method Detail

      • getFont

        public java.lang.String getFont()
        The font name is a character string that represents the name of the font, already loaded on the printer, that you wish to print with.
        Returns:
        The font name or the empty string if the default printer font is to be used.

      • getIsInverse

        public boolean getIsInverse()
        The inverse property, if set to true, will cause the image to print white on a black background instead of the traditional black on a white background. The default value for this property is false.
        Returns:
        The value 'true' if the property is set or 'false' otherwise.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • setIsInverse

        public void setIsInverse(boolean isPrintingInverse)
        The inverse property, if set to true, will cause the image to print white on a black background instead of the traditional black on a white background. The default value for this property is false.
        Parameters:
        isPrintingInverse - A boolean which is set to true if you wish to print inverse or false if you wish to print normally.
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • getHorizontalMultiplier

        public int getHorizontalMultiplier()
        The horizontal multiplier property will cause the horizontal printing of the object to be scaled by that amount. So a value of two would cause a printing of the object to be double its original width. The default value for this parameter is 1.
        Returns:
        The value the horizontal dimension will be scaled by.

      • getVerticalMultiplier

        public int getVerticalMultiplier()
        The vertical multiplier property will cause the vertical printing of the object to be scaled by that amount. So a value of two would cause a printing of the object to be double its original height. The default value for this parameter is 1.
        Returns:
        The value the vertical dimension will be scaled by.

      • getTextEncoding

        public java.lang.String getTextEncoding()
        Get the current text encoding for text data
        Returns:
        current text encoding

      • setTextEncoding

        public void setTextEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
        Set the text encoding for the text data
        Parameters:
        encoding - encoding to be used for text
